channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SWARM-705] Sporadic build failure on wildfly-swarm-plugin package : Unable to create -swarm.jar
item.description:
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.wildfly.swarm:wildfly-swarm-plugin:2016.9:package (package) on project microservice-session: Unable to create -swarm.jar: D:\github\microprofile-conference\microservice-session\target\microservice-session.war -> D:\github\microprofile-conference\microservice-session\target\microservice-session.war.original: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process. -> [Help 1]

item.summary: Sporadic build failure on wildfly-swarm-plugin package : Unable to create -swarm.jar

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting back here Andy Gumbrecht. IIRC something along these lines was reported before, but I'll have to dig it up. But to my knowledge this only happens on Windows.

Underlying Win IO is async and rapid IO in the same parent directory can often cause this problem, even when IO has been closed on the file.
Mulithreaded IO will cause this error and adding synchronized to file handling methods (even static methods) will usually eliminate this issue.
It can also often be solved by adding a sleep(5) retry after a failure, although not pretty.
Bob McWhirter Do you remember the previous reports? IIRC you have been working in it back then...
Andy Gumbrecht But regardless of that error, a Swarm build should be using Java 8.
You're welcome Heiko Braun - Happy to checkout the source and try a few things if you like?
Yep sorry, build IS running on j8 - just pasted from a console using j7 to build tomee

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
git clone https://github.com/microprofile/microprofile-conference.git
cd microprofile-conference
mvn clean install -DskipTests -e

Does not fail every time...
